newsitem.title: TURKEY: Istanbul gold prices firm slightly.
newsitem.headline: Istanbul gold prices firm slightly.

text.p: Gold prices firmed slightly on the Istanbul Gold Exchange on Thursday in another day of thin trade due to weak demand and uncertain world trends, dealers said.
Gold closed at $383.25 an ounce, up from $383.00 on Wednesday, and 1,215,500 lira per gram, against a previous 1,213,600 lira.
Volume remained low at 405 kilos after Wednesday's 483.
Dealers said the direction of gold prices worldwide was uncertain and demand had been restrained since Tuesday, when volume shot up to 1,031 kilos.
A weaker Turkish lira, which eased against the dollar to 98,525 from Wednesday's 98,410 close, also buoyed lira prices on the gold exchange.
Some 285 kilos of gold traded in the morning session, and 81.5 percent of total turnover was in lira terms.
